Topic: Draw a string telephone between two students.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a simple device connecting two students, indicating a basic understanding of how a string telephone functions.
The student can show two students engaging with the string telephone to send and receive information, likely using facial expressions or gestures to indicate communication.
The student can demonstrate a basic use of sound waves by drawing lines or arrows to suggest sound traveling between the cups.
The student can label or illustrate materials like cups and string, indicating some knowledge of what makes up the string telephone.
CANNOT: The student may struggle to accurately illustrate how sound waves carry information beyond basic lines or arrows, occasionally placing these disproportionately *(student thinks longer waves are louder)*.

The student might miss demonstrating the full importance of technology in communication, perhaps not clearly linking the device's use to solving real-world communication needs *(student might not contextualize outside school scenarios)*.
